<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<Map<String, String>> iter = allFieldValues.iterator();
for (int i = 0; i < givenRowAsParameter; i++){
    iter.next();
}
Map<String, String> row = iter.next();
String cellValue = row.get(columnName);
<<<explanation>>>: After iterating through the collection to reach the desired row, you can use the next() method again to get the specific row as a map. Then, you can use the get() method on the map to retrieve the value of the specific cell based on the column name.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<Map<String, String>> iter = allFieldValues.iterator();
for (int i = 0; i < givenRowAsParameter; i++){
    iter.next();
}
Map<String, String> row = iter.next();
String value = row.get(columnName);
<<<explanation>>>: After iterating to the desired row, you can use iter.next() again to get the specific row as a Map. Then, you can use the get() method of the Map to retrieve the value of the specific column. Make sure to replace "columnName" with the actual column name you want to retrieve the value from.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<Map<String, String>> iter = allFieldValues.iterator();
for (int i = 0; i <= givenRowAsParameter; i++){
    if (i == givenRowAsParameter) {
        Map<String, String> row = iter.next();
        String value = row.get(columnName);
        // Use the value of the specific cell
    } else {
        iter.next();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use a nested loop to iterate through the rows and columns of the collection. In the outer loop, iterate through the rows until you reach the given row number. In the inner loop, iterate through the columns and retrieve the value of the specific cell using the column name.
